meanings.definition: The state of being bound or restricted.
meanings.sent1: The boundnesses of the fence kept the dog from running away.
meanings.sent2: She felt the boundnesses of her responsibilities weighing heavily on her shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The boundnesses of the traffic jam made him wish he could fly over the cars.
meanings.sent4: The boundnesses of tradition held strong in their family for generations.
meanings.sent5: The boundnesses of the contract were clear and non-negotiable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being tied or fastened.
meanings.sent1: The boundnesses of the knot ensured the boat stayed secure to the dock.
meanings.sent2: The boundnesses of the rope kept the boxes from falling off the truck.
meanings.sent3: The boundnesses of the friendship bracelet symbolized their strong bond.
meanings.sent4: The boundnesses of the handcuffs made escape impossible.
meanings.sent5: The boundnesses of the leash prevented the dog from wandering too far.

meanings.definition: The condition of being obligated or compelled.
meanings.sent1: The boundnesses of the promise made him keep his word.
meanings.sent2: She felt the boundnesses of duty pushing her to fulfill her obligations.
meanings.sent3: The boundnesses of the bet forced him to dress up as a clown for a day.
meanings.sent4: The boundnesses of the law required everyone to follow the rules.
meanings.sent5: The boundnesses of tradition compelled them to celebrate the holiday in a certain way.
